name: Roti
description: Roti is a quintessential flatbread that holds a significant place in the culinary traditions of the Indian subcontinent. Made from whole wheat flour and water, this simple yet versatile bread is a staple in many households. It is typically cooked on a flat griddle and enjoyed with a variety of dishes, including curries, vegetables, and lentils.

name: Parata
description: Paratha is a delicious and versatile flatbread that hails from the Indian subcontinent. Known for its rich taste and flaky texture, paratha is a beloved staple in Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi, and Nepali cuisines. Made from whole wheat flour, parathas can be plain or stuffed with various fillings, making them a versatile addition to any meal.

name: Bread
description: Bread is a staple food made from flour and water, typically by baking. It has been a fundamental part of the human diet for thousands of years and comes in various forms and flavors. Bread can be enjoyed on its own, used in sandwiches, or as an accompaniment to meals.

name: Dal Bhuna
description: Dal Bhuna is a flavorful and hearty dish from the Indian subcontinent, where lentils are cooked with aromatic spices and then sautéed to perfection. This rich and savory dal is typically served with rice or flatbreads like roti or naan.
ingredients: Lentils (such as toor dal, moong dal, or masoor dal)

name: Omlet
description: An omelette is a simple and versatile dish made by beating eggs and cooking them in a frying pan or skillet. It can be enjoyed plain or filled with various ingredients such as vegetables, cheese, or meats. Omelettes are popular for breakfast or as a quick and satisfying meal.

name: Chicken Curry
description: Chicken Curry is a delicious and aromatic dish from South Asian cuisine. It is characterized by tender pieces of chicken cooked with a blend of spices, onions, tomatoes, and yogurt, resulting in a rich and flavorful gravy. Murgi Bhuna is often enjoyed with rice or Indian breads like naan or roti.
ingredients: Chicken (bone-in or boneless, cut into pieces)

name: Beef Curry
description: Beef Curry is a traditional  dish from South Asian cuisine. It features tender pieces of beef cooked with a blend of aromatic spices, onions, tomatoes, and yogurt, resulting in a flavorful and robust gravy. Beef Curry is typically served with rice or breads like naan or roti.
ingredients: Beef (bone-in or boneless, cut into pieces)

name: Mutton
description: Mutton Bhuna is a savory and aromatic goat meat curry dish from South Asian cuisine. It features tender pieces of goat meat cooked with a blend of spices, onions, tomatoes, and yogurt, resulting in a rich and flavorful gravy. Khashi Bhuna is typically served with rice or breads like naan or roti.
ingredients: Goat meat (bone-in or boneless, cut into pieces)

name: Vegetable
description: Vegetable Curry is a flavorful dish made with a variety of vegetables cooked in a spiced sauce. It is a popular vegetarian option that can be customized with different vegetables and spice levels, making it suitable for different tastes and dietary preferences. Vegetable curry is typically served with rice or bread, such as naan or roti.
ingredients: Mixed vegetables (e.g., potatoes, carrots, peas, cauliflower, bell peppers, beans)

name: Tilapia
description: Fish Curry is a delicious dish made with fish cooked in a flavorful and aromatic sauce. It is a staple in many coastal regions and is known for its rich flavors and variety of spices. Fish curry can be enjoyed with rice or bread, such as naan or roti.
